feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 6:43AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Becoming Windy With Blowing Snow This Weekend... North winds are expected to increase to 30 mph through the Bering Strait, over St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta on Saturday, then increase to 40 mph Saturday night and continuing into Sunday. This will cause blowing snow with reduced visibility. It is uncertain if falling snow will occur, but if falling snow does

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 6:43AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds And Blowing Snow Over Atigun Pass This Weekend... South winds gusting to 35 mph are expected to develop over Atigun Pass Saturday afternoon and continue into Sunday. This will cause blowing and drifting snow with reduced visibility, and could cause travel difficulties over Atigun Pass Saturday afternoon into Sunday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 6:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Several Inches Of Snow Saturday Into Sunday... Snow is expected to develop Saturday and continue into Saturday night and possibly into Sunday. Several inches of snow is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Interior Seward Peninsula; Lower Kobuk Valley; Lower Koyukuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 6:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall This Weekend... Snow is expected to develop late tonight and continue into Saturday night. Snow could be heavy at times. Storm total snowfalls of 4 to 6 inches are expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 1:06PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG STORM EXPECTED SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A storm force front is expected to move into the area from the SW on Saturday spreading gusty winds and heavy precipitation across the region. Most of the precipitation is expected to fall as rain with the highest rain rates expected Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. Total rainfall of around 1 to 3 inches is expected

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 3:15AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM NOON EST TODAY THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... Relative humidity values are expected to drop below 25 percent for a few hours this afternoon across northeast Georgia. Despite light south to southwest winds, the dry fuels and low relative humidity will lead to increased fire danger conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Elbert; Franklin; Habersham; Hart; Rabun; Stephens

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 3:01AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING IN NORTH GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES. Relative humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours between this afternoon and this evening. Winds will be from the southeast at 3 to 6 MPH. With dry fuels in place, high fire danger conditions can be expected.
